alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 30 at 3:07PM MST until July 30 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 306 PM MST, an area of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Kearny to 12 miles northeast of Picacho Peak State Park to 6 miles north of Avra Valley, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 231. Route 79 between mile markers 107 and 128. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124. Locations impacted include... Eloy, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Red Rock, Cactus Forest, North Komelik, Kohatk, Jack Rabbit, Shopishk and East Chui-Chu. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
